description: Variation of condition 9 to change timing of lodgement of required documentation regarding mechanical plant, of planning permission ref: PP/2013/2248 dated 07/08/2013 for the demolition of existing pair of semi-detached, two storey properties, and replacement with a six storey building incoporating Retail uses (A1/A2/A3 Use Classes) at ground floor level (261.5 sqm net), and nine residential units (7x 2 bedroom flats and 2x 3 bedroom flats) over the upper five floor levels, integrated balconies, bicycle storage, and refuse and recycling storage areas
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | 2. The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers 801/01; 801/06; 801/07; 801/08; 801/09; 801/10; 801/11; 801/12; 801/13; 801/14.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be implemented in accordance with the samples approved under planning approval ref: PP/2014/5265, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (g), 1.2 (f) of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan - consolidated (2015). | All residential dwellings hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), SPG 7, policy 7.2 of The London Plan, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework. | Details of the refuse and recycling facility shall be implemented in accordance with the samples approved under planning approval ref: PP/2014/5273. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained in perpetuity.  Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e)(f) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2015) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Logistics Plan shall be Implemented in accordance with PP/2014/5276. The Construction Logistics Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 6.3 and 6.11 of the London Plan (2015). | Full details of both hard and soft landscape works, together with a 5 year management plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and implemented prior to the occupation of any part of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority and permanently retained thereafter. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To enhance the character of the area and ensure a satisfactory visual appearance to the development in accordance with policies LV.7.4 and 7B of the adopted Development Management DPD, policies 1.1 (g) and 1.2 (f) of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan - consolidated (2015). | Prior to the commencement of any part of the development hereby approved details of a communal outdoor amenity space at the first floor level above the existing retail unit shall be implemented in accordance with planning approval PP/2014/5281. The agreed details shall be implemented in full.  Reason: To provide the residential units, and especially the family sized units, with a suitable sized outdoor amenity space in accordance with policies 3.4 and 3.5 of the London Plan 2015. | Full details (including the siting) of the mechanical plant and equipment, flues and air moving equipment shall be implemented in accordance with planning approval PP/2014/5281. The agreed details shall be implemented in full.  Reason: To protect the amenity of future occupiers and neighbouring residential properties in accordance with policies 3.4 and 3.5 of the London Plan 2015, and policy 7B of the Publication Version Development Management Plan Document. | Impact piling shall take place in accordance with a piling method statement approved under planning approval ref: PP/2014/5285.  Reason: The proposed works maybe in close proximity to underground sewerage utility Infrastructure. | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no residents of the flat shall obtain resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that proposal does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone, in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012) and policies 6.13 and 8.2 the London Plan (2015).
